issue.title: open.spotify.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2F) ### Comment > Spotify player gets stuck on ads sometimes on web player with AdGuard enabled - no songs, nothing, not even ad plays. Only solution is to refresh the browser and replay the playlist. Trying to change playlist doesn't work either, completely stuck playerand now playing view. While with AdGuard disabled, ads load normally and player works as intended. One important thing: It happens after 2-3 times ads are skipped. e.g I open player, play a playlist, ads come normally due course, gets skipped twice or even thrice, songs playing uninterrupted, after that it gets stuck on ad and nothing plays. Like spotify detects adblocker is on after 2-3 skips and blocks plays (guess). ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/83mi74u948w0g4kgws88k0sg8g8k4sg9pssix2rkdg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/2vay4knk3su8oowwo0ko4og4c880sgonwbv61x27r4.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.2.500.7 MV3 System version: | `Windows 11` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,

comment.body:
Hi, MV3 extension cannot update filters due to a Google policy. Therefore, the new rules will be available in an upcoming extension update.

You can add this as your custom rule in the meantime:

```adblock
@@||p3-tt.byteimg.com/obj/$domain=agedm.io
```

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: trilltrill.jp

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

Even though the filter has been selected, even when I select all the filters, I still can't go to the next stage.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: REPORT says "Annoyance filters are required for quality filtering. Please enable them in AdGuard"
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 5.2.500.10 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Chrome ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? it says "Annoyance filters are required for quality filtering. Please enable them in AdGuard" and can't go to the next step ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. 2. Screenshots ils>Screenshot 1:
Screenshot N:
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: It's because the app isn't processing it to the web filter reporter thing. This should be moved to https://github.com/AdguardTeam/ReportsWebApp @Alex-302

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://aniworld.to/anime/stream/farming-life-in-another-world/staffel-1/episode-2](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Faniworld.to%2Fanime%2Fstream%2Ffarming-life-in-another-world%2Fstaffel-1%2Fepisode-2) ### Comment > Wenn die Seite geöffnet wird, erscheinen manchmal zwei Pop-ups. Wenn man die Seite neu lädt, kommen sie sofort nicht mehr. Aber wenn man ein paar Sekunden später in einem neuen Browser-Tab die Seite wieder aufruft, sind die Pop-ups wieder da. I use DNS to bypass the Xbox lockdown, since I am in Russia , and the console was imported in parallel. Until recently, everything worked, then from time to time there were connection problems, and now Xbox remote play has completely stopped working. ### Screenshots

issue.title: [False Negative]: add 5 phishing domains (coinomi[.]co[.]com, trust-download[.]co[.]com, ...)
issue.body:
> [!IMPORTANT] > ## Executive Summary > > This report documents 5 domain(s) that have been identified as part of active phishing operations. These domains exhibit characteristics consistent with malicious infrastructure and pose an immediate security risk to internet users. The following 5 domain(s) have been analyzed and confirmed as participating in phishing campaign(s): ``` coinomi.co.com trust-download.co.com app-phantom.co.com app-atomic.co.com trust-wallet-app.to ``` ## Threat Analysis ### Phishing Attack Details These domains are part of a phishing campaign targeting cryptocurrency companies and cryptocurrency holders/investors. Attackers may use fake login pages, fake Web3 wallet connection prompts, fake cryptocurrency exchange/swap interfaces, or modified/malicious software to steal cryptocurrency seed phrases/keys. ### Technical Details - Cloaked. This means: if a request does not meet certain internal rules of the attacker, the request may be redirected to a non-existent subdomain "www.www.", a legitimate website, or display various HTTP errors such as 403, 404, 502, etc., SSL certificate errors, infinite loading, or a fake Cloudflare (or other service) CAPTCHA, or show content distinguishable from the phishing page. ### Detections & Targeted Brands - `coinomi.co.com` targets Coinomi Wallet (coinomi.com) - VirusTotal: **2 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/coinomi.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=coinomi.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=coinomi.co.com - `trust-download.co.com` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trust-download.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trust-download.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=trust-download.co.com - `app-phantom.co.com` targets Phantom Wallet (phantom.com) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/app-phantom.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=app-phantom.co.com - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=app-phantom.co.com - `app-atomic.co.com` targets Atomic Wallet (atomicwallet.io) - VirusTotal: **0 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/app-atomic.co.com/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=app-atomic.co.com - `trust-wallet-app.to` targets Trust Wallet (trustwallet.com) - VirusTotal: **3 detections** - https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/trust-wallet-app.to/detection - Listed on Spamhaus - https://check.spamhaus.org/results/?query=trust-wallet-app.to - Listed on APVA - https://api.antiphish.org/v1/lookup?host=trust-wallet-app.to ### Diagrams
Phishing Campaign Mindmap Overview ```mermaid %%{init: {'theme': 'base', 'themeVariables': {'primaryColor': '#f97316', 'primaryTextColor': '#ffffff', 'primaryBorderColor': '#ea580c', 'lineColor': '#fb923c', 'secondaryColor': '#fed7aa', 'tertiaryColor': '#fff7ed'}}}%% mindmap root((Phishing Campaign
5 domains)) ))TARGETS(( ["Trust Wallet"] (trust-download.co.com) (trust-wallet-app.to) ["Coinomi Wallet"] (coinomi.co.com) ["Phantom Wallet"] (app-phantom.co.com) ["Atomic Wallet"] (app-atomic.co.com) ))INFRASTRUCTURE(( {{"AS57523 Chang Way Technologies Co. Limited"}} 45.93.20.38 ))REGISTRARS(( ("NICENIC INTERNATIONAL GROUP CO., LIMITED") ```

issue.title: trilltrill.jp

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body:
> > tinyShield has not been maintained for a few weeks.
> > There is no addition of a domain, and the issue is also neglected. That's why there's no point in reporting.
> 

The project isn't abandoned, but is in a process of large transformation: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/217948#issuecomment-3539801087

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.fedex.com/fedextrack/system-error?trknbr=886437387966](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fedex.com%2Ffedextrack%2Fsystem-error%3Ftrknbr%3D886437387966) ### Comment > Have adguard enabled globally, visit fedex.com in Waterfox (or presumably Firefox ESR) and try to track a package, you will get an error. > > Disabling protection for this site still results in an error. > > Manually disabling ad blocking, tracking protection, browsing security, dns > protection, and extensions in adblock settings still results in an error. > > Disabling adguard globally (right click on adguard in the system tray, choose open adguard, click on the toggle to disable all protection globally) makes it work. > > Chrom* works normally. ### Screenshots
